items.title: Nvidia’s RTX 50-series Super refresh is delayed, and the RTX 60-series might miss 2027
items.summary: The Super refresh to Nvidia's RTX 50-series GPUs was expected at CES 2026 in January, but it didn't make an appearance. The Information reports that in December, Nvidia managers decided not to release the new cards as scheduled, choosing to prioritize AI chips instead due to the limited supply of RAM currently available. On top […]

items.title: Gemini exits the UK, EU and Australia and cuts 25% of staff, as the crypto exchange refocuses on the US due to foreign markets proving "hard to win" (Naga Avan-Nomayo/The Block)
items.summary:
Naga Avan-Nomayo / The Block:
Gemini exits the UK, EU and Australia and cuts 25% of staff, as the crypto exchange refocuses on the US due to foreign markets proving “hard to win”  —  Quick Take  — Gemini links its latest layoffs to a push for a leaner, more automated operating model, saying increased use of AI lets it run faster with fewer staff.

items.title: Clearance pricing hits PS5/PC compatible HyperX’s Cloud Stinger Core wireless gaming headset at $40 (Save 50%)
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Best Buy that drops HyperX’s Cloud Stinger Core wireless gaming headset in white down to $39.99 shipped. This headset has long been a go-to option for folks looking to buy a reliable and budget-friendly gaming headset. The white variant discounted today at Best Buy is compatible with PC and PS5, and it’s been mostly sold out across other retailers. The black model is currently going for $60 at Amazon, but today’s Best Buy deal undercuts that by an extra $20, setting a new best price to beat. It’s an already affordable model that’s now going for even less at 50% off, so be sure to snag one before stock runs out.

more…

items.summary: The ransomware attack at Conduent allowed hackers to steal a "significant number of individuals’ personal information" from the govtech giant's systems. Conduent handles personal and health data of more than 100 million people across America.

items.summary:
Update 2/5: Not only is this exclusive deal still live for an unknown amount of time longer, but the savings have increased to $3,479, landing this bundle at a new all-time low of $4,319.10 shipped, after using the code below.

We’ve secured quite the exclusive deal from Wellbots to keep your home running during power outages, with folks able to pick up the EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra Portable Power Station with a Smart Home Panel 2 and a FREE trolley at $4,409.10 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5DPUJAN at checkout. This bundle (without the trolley) starts from a $7,997 full price tag, both here and directly from the brand, while at Amazon it’s priced a little lower at $7,499. The discounts we’ve seen over the last year have mostly kept the costs down between $5,599 and $4,999, though it did go as low as $4,699 – but again, this is without the trolley, which only occasionally gets included for free during some direct sales. While these exclusive savings last, you’ll be getting a larger-than-ever $3,090 cut from the going rate (not counting the FREE trolley that is valued at $299), giving you a total $3,389 savings and a new all-time low price to bolster your home support with.

JOYROOM Qi2 3-in-1 Wireless Charging Station

Buy for $15 (Reg. $25)

Enterr promo code HMMSL8AN for $10 off coupon.

What we love

While this unit may not boast the latest 25W Qi2.2 charging speeds you get with some of the newer options, it still outpaces most alternatives with solid 15W Qi2 support. items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Lenovo that gets you the brand’s Chromebook Duet 11 Gen 9 model for $329.99 shipped. This is originally a $400 unit that has lately been fetching $440 directly at the brand’s online store. Today’s deal delivers a 25% markdown, shaving $120 off its usual going rate. This is one of the lowest prices we have tracked for this bundle that gets you a Chromebook along with a Folio Keyboard with a stand and a USI Pen 2 for free. That’s a pretty solid value considering this bundle costs less than Apple’s Magic Keyboards alone which tends to go as high as $335 and don’t even include an iPad.
